content.description: On the right side of this boulder just left of the tree, climb up on a technical face, it is straight forward just has small holds due to the nature of face climbing. Great top out. Very nice slab climbing. If you fall it may be wise to push out and left a little so you do not grind down the slab or fall into the tree.

Stand start eight - ten feet left of Hitting The Road on an obvious flake, work this flake until the arete starts trending right, while moving right on this arete there are small feet but the hand holds are big enough it is very possible to smear for this rightward traverse. There is no defined crux just easy fun climbing. 

  Good for beginners to get adjusted to the heights.
content.location: left end on Long Slab Boulder

content.description: A slab boulder, that has a great top out but fairly small holds and a good crack to traverse problem. Strong fingers and a strong head is important on all these routes.
